channel.title: Carpal Tunnel/Cubital Tunnel
channel.description:
Just been diagnosed with mild carpal tunnel in both wrists, and mild cubital tunnel in both elbows.
Just wondering because I know carpal tunnel is very common in computer orientated workspaces/environments if anyone here has had any experience with it? I've been deemed that the only fix for it will be surgical, so if you've had carpal tunnel release, what was your experience?
From what I can find on google it seems like a simple release of the nerves. Just after some first hand experience such as; recovery time, any advice, etc.
Cheers.
ps yes I realized I probably should of posted this on mitb.

item.title: Carpal Tunnel/Cubital Tunnel
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Consider it a bump, but I’m currently 4 days post op of my left arm.

Nowhere near as bad blow-out on my left arm compared to my right, it’s nowhere near as sore and tender either.

Read full topic

item.title: Carpal Tunnel/Cubital Tunnel
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Frell:

I know what you mean. People starting who don’t have the wrist strength seem to let the weights wreck havoc on their joints

Now that I’m wiser on this subject, I can guarantee I will never workout without wrist braces/splints. Perhaps I was lucky this happened to me while I was still young and I was able to learn from it for the future

Read full topic

item.description:

Frell:

I can’t get as much power if my wrists are bent

99% of people I see on bench presses etc bench with their wrists bent. Ofcourse their issues will not surface until later in life, mine just surfaced earlier.

item.title: Carpal Tunnel/Cubital Tunnel
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

Yz85Racer:

Frell, I’d advise you to be careful if you’re still lifting. Take it from me in this situation, don’t take this shit lightly. Always make sure you’re not overgripping and your wrists are never, ever bent when weightlifting

I use gloves that lock my wrist in place when I work out, well not fully lock, I still have a little degree of freedom

Read full topic

item.title: Carpal Tunnel/Cubital Tunnel
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:24, topic:478236”]wait yz

you know construction workers can get carpal tunnel from using a jackhammer too often right? did your bike’s vibrations contribute? Or does the bike not vibrate that much[/quote]
Carpal tunnel can be caused by soooo many things it’s not funny.

That would make sense, however when my nerves were tested it was found to be caused from compartment syndrome in my forearms; not from an RSI. Compartment syndrome, in my case, was caused by underdevelopment of the fascia in my forearms because of constantly having bent wrists which puts tension on the nerves/muscles.

Frell, I’d advise you to be careful if you’re still lifting. Take it from me in this situation, don’t take this shit lightly. Always make sure you’re not overgripping and your wrists are never, ever bent when weightlifting

Read full topic

item.title: Carpal Tunnel/Cubital Tunnel
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:20, topic:478236”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=596435.msg4216302#msg4216302 date=1360308980]

I have Carpal Tunnel aswell

1 arm down, 1 to go.
[/quote]
In both arms actually. I found that out when I felt an extreme pain in my hands/wrists, my mom said it was likely Carpal Tunnel because of how much I play on the computer and she was right, as we went to a doctor and he confirmed it[/quote]
I meant for my surgeries. I have to have this rectified because of lifestyle reasons; usually if its from posture etc it can be fixed by correcting whatever the cause is… I just don’t have time to wait.

Niall, 1 thing I’ve learned is to make sure your wrists are elevated off the table when on the computer otherwise you’re putting pressure on the carpal tunnel. And, if you’re resting on your elbow to rest on the bone, because your ulnar and radial nerve run beside the point and if they’re pressured continuosly youll damage them

Read full topic

item.title: Carpal Tunnel/Cubital Tunnel
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I find that whatever posture your back is in (though I have a pretty good sitting posture anyway) and however you keep your legs, so long as your arms naturally rest on the keyboard/mouse as seen in the above pic then you shouldn’t have any problems

I’ve been using this posture since 2002, since 2005-6 I’ve been using the pc at least 5-6 hours a day and about the worse pains I get is in my knees (unrelated to posture) and on my elbow when I lean on my arm rests EDIT: my arm rests are mostly for use when I’m leaning back in my chair watching a movie/tv episode/playing ps3, rather than being used when I’m using the pc

Read full topic

item.title: Carpal Tunnel/Cubital Tunnel
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:11, topic:478236”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=596435.msg4201971#msg4201971 date=1358335231]

I played drums for a little bit before getting carpal tunnel. Mine was pretty mild, but the only thing you’ll expierence on the lower wrist (if its mild) is annoying pain. If you position your hands right on the keyboard its supposed to help but I’m not sure on the correct way to do it.
Just chill out on typing a lot and you should be okay. Good luck and I hope you don’t need surgery :s

I barely EVER type anymore, if you’ve noticed my activity. I guarantee if I’m on a computer, I post on mscp/mitb. So whether or not it was bought on by my heavy computer use a few years ago when I was into programming, idk.

I have gone out and forked out a lot on new computer equipment to position myself when I do infact use the computer. I’ve followed my surgeons instructions fully when redesigning my computer environment. I now sit on an exercise ball so I do not lean on my wrists (seriously, this might sound weird but sitting on it now my wrists are not touching the desk at all. I feel very uncomfortable and make typing mistakes because I usually type with my wrists bent at an angle, and now type with them straight.

I’ve gone through the needed precautions, nerve glide physiotherapy, etc and there’s nothing left but to do than to operate. I have had operations in the past but this one, I can successfully say has me scared because I know when you start messing with nerves there’s a lot of room for things to happen and backlash in the future - still, my surgeon has been my surgeon all my life and is a very well respected specialist in this area.
[/quote]

Sounds like you have it all taken care of. Like I said, mine was mild and really never needed surgery. My wrist will annoy me every once in a while but thats it.(I dont really play drums anymore either)
If you’re nervous about surgery you could wait a little bit since you’ve taken the steps to try and help yourself. If it comes to the point where your just miserable than tell him to cut you open, but by then it might not be mild.
Good luck with whatever decision you make.[/quote]
Time is not an option for me unfortunately.

My carpal tunnel is affecting my sport, which is affecting my lifestyle. If I can’t perform, I will lose my support/sponsors most likely and it will not be exactly ideal. Hence why I didn’t muck around. I was diagnosed, and in 3 weeks I am being operated on after diagnosis.

Read full topic

item.title: Carpal Tunnel/Cubital Tunnel
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:6, topic:478236”][quote author=jal knight link=topic=596435.msg4201805#msg4201805 date=1358303784]
I played drums for a little bit before getting carpal tunnel. Mine was pretty mild, but the only thing you’ll expierence on the lower wrist (if its mild) is annoying pain. If you position your hands right on the keyboard its supposed to help but I’m not sure on the correct way to do it.
Just chill out on typing a lot and you should be okay. Good luck and I hope you don’t need surgery :s
[/quote]
I barely EVER type anymore, if you’ve noticed my activity. I guarantee if I’m on a computer, I post on mscp/mitb. So whether or not it was bought on by my heavy computer use a few years ago when I was into programming, idk.

I have gone out and forked out a lot on new computer equipment to position myself when I do infact use the computer. I’ve followed my surgeons instructions fully when redesigning my computer environment. I now sit on an exercise ball so I do not lean on my wrists (seriously, this might sound weird but sitting on it now my wrists are not touching the desk at all. I feel very uncomfortable and make typing mistakes because I usually type with my wrists bent at an angle, and now type with them straight.

I’ve gone through the needed precautions, nerve glide physiotherapy, etc and there’s nothing left but to do than to operate. I have had operations in the past but this one, I can successfully say has me scared because I know when you start messing with nerves there’s a lot of room for things to happen and backlash in the future - still, my surgeon has been my surgeon all my life and is a very well respected specialist in this area.[/quote]

Sounds like you have it all taken care of. Like I said, mine was mild and really never needed surgery. My wrist will annoy me every once in a while but thats it.(I dont really play drums anymore either)
If you’re nervous about surgery you could wait a little bit since you’ve taken the steps to try and help yourself. If it comes to the point where your just miserable than tell him to cut you open, but by then it might not be mild.
Good luck with whatever decision you make.

Read full topic

item.title: Carpal Tunnel/Cubital Tunnel
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

asshole_rule:

Would just like to know how much the surgery to fix it is?

I don’t know, here in Australia it’s covered by Medicare so it’s a free surgery. However I am having it done through a private surgeon of my choice, and it’s only, after the medical rebate of private health care, $210 out of pocket. The anesthetist is about $120 after medical rebate aswell.

Read full topic

I now sit on an exercise ball so I do not lean on my wrists (seriously, this might sound weird but sitting on it now my wrists are not touching the desk at all. I feel very uncomfortable and make typing mistakes because I usually type with my wrists bent at an angle, and now type with them straight.

for the past 7 years I’ve used the computer for 10 hours a day average (figures pulled out of my arse) and I’ve never had carpal tunnel type symptoms, the only thing I’ve done is had a good posture[/quote]
